integer.description: Controls the maximum number of connections that can be borrowed from the pool at one time. When set to a negative value, there is no limit to the number of connections that may be active at one time. When maxActive is exceeded, the pool is said to be exhausted.
integer.caption: Max active
integer.name: maxActive

integer.description: Controls the maximum number of connections that can sit idle in the pool at any time. When set to a negative value, there is no limit to the number of connections that may be idle at one time.
integer.caption: Max idle
integer.name: maxIdle

enum.description: Determines how connections in a pool should be initialized. The possible values are: INITIALISE_NONE (will not load any connection into the pool on startup), INITIALISE_ONE (will load one initial connection into the pool on startup), or INITIALISE_ALL (will load all connections in the pool on startup)
enum.caption: Initialisation policy
enum.name: initialisationPolicy

enum.description: Specifies the behavior of the connection pool when the pool is exhausted. Possible values are: "WHEN_EXHAUSTED_FAIL", which will throw a NoSuchElementException, "WHEN_EXHAUSTED_WAIT", which will block by invoking Object.wait(long) until a new or idle object is available, or WHEN_EXHAUSTED_GROW, which will create a new connection and return it, essentially making maxActive meaningless. If a positive maxWait value is supplied, it will block for at most that many milliseconds, after which a NoSuchElementException will be thrown. If maxThreadWait is a negative value, it will block indefinitely.
enum.caption: Exhausted action
enum.name: exhaustedAction

integer.description: When exhausted action is Wait (or block) this is the amount of time in milliseconds that the pool will wait before failing. Setting a negative value will block indefinitely until an idle instance becomes available.
integer.caption: Max wait
integer.name: maxWait

integer.description: Determines the minimum amount of time a connection may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction. When non-positive, no connections will be evicted from the pool due to idle time alone.
integer.caption: Min eviction (ms)
integer.name: minEvictionMillis

integer.description: Specifies the number of milliseconds between runs of the connection evictor. When non-positive, no connection evictor is executed.
integer.caption: Eviction check interval (ms)
integer.name: evictionCheckIntervalMillis

label.caption: Define how mule should attempt to handle a connection failure
label.name: connectionLabel

radioBoolean.caption: Do not use a Reconnection strategy
radioBoolean.name: noReconnection

radioBoolean.description: A reconnection strategy that allows the user to configure how many times a reconnection should be attempted and how long to wait between attempts.
radioBoolean.caption: Standard Reconnection
radioBoolean.name: standardReconnection

integer.description: How many reconnection attempts to make
integer.caption: Reconnection Attempts
integer.name: reconnectionAttemps

boolean.description: A reconnection strategy that retries an infinite number of times at the specified frequency.
boolean.caption: Reconnect Forever
boolean.name: reconnectForever

classname.description: A class that implements the RetryPolicyTemplate interface.
classname.caption: Class
classname.name: class

name.description: Give a name to this configuration so it can be later referenced by config-ref.
name.caption: Name
name.name: name

string.description: The access key provided by Amazon, needed for non annoynous operations.
string.caption: Access Key
string.name: accessKey

string.description: The secrete key provided by Amazon, needed for non annoynous operations.
string.caption: Secret Key
string.name: secretKey

string.description: The optional proxy username.
string.caption: Proxy Username
string.name: proxyUsername

string.description: The optional proxy port.
string.caption: Proxy Host
string.name: proxyHost

string.description: The optional proxy password.
string.caption: Proxy Password
string.name: proxyPassword

integer.description: The amount of time to wait (in milliseconds) when initially establishing a connection before giving up and timing out. A value of 0 means infinity, and is not recommended.
integer.caption: Connection Timeout
integer.name: connectionTimeout

integer.description: The amount of time to wait (in milliseconds) for data to be transfered over an established, open connection before the connection is timed out. A value of 0 means infinity, and is not recommended.
integer.caption: Socket Timeout
integer.name: socketTimeout

globalRef.description: Specify which configuration to use for this invocation.
globalRef.caption: Connector Configuration
globalRef.name: config-ref

cloud-connector.description: Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service) is an online storage web service offered by Amazon Web Services. Amazon S3 provides storage through web services interfaces (REST, SOAP, and BitTorrent).
cloud-connector.caption: Amazon S3

string.description: The destination object's bucket. If none provided, a local copy is performed, that is, it is copied within the same bucket.
string.caption: Destination Bucket Name
string.name: destinationBucketName

string.description: The destination object's key.
string.caption: Destination Key
string.name: destinationKey

string.description: The source object's bucket.
string.caption: Source Bucket Name
string.name: sourceBucketName

string.description: The source object's key.
string.caption: Source Key
string.name: sourceKey

string.description: The specific version of the source object to copy, if versioning is enabled. Left unspecified if the latest version is desired, or versioning is not enabled.
string.caption: Source Version Id
string.name: sourceVersionId

string.description: The modified constraint that restricts this request to executing only if the object has been modified after the specified date. This constraint is specified but does not match, no copy is performed.
string.caption: Modified Since
string.name: modifiedSince

string.description: The unmodified constraint that restricts this request to executing only if the object has not been modified after this date. This constraint is specified but does not match, no copy is performed.
string.caption: Unmodified Since
string.name: unmodifiedSince

string.description: Encryption method for server-side encryption. Supported value AES256.
string.caption: Encryption
string.name: encryption

enum.description: The acl of the destination object.
enum.caption: Destination Acl
enum.name: destinationAcl

enum.description: One of enumerated values, defaults to.
enum.caption: Destination Storage Class

element-controller-map.caption: Destination User Metadata

string.description: The content to be uploaded to S3, capable of creating a .

string.name: content-ref

integer.description: The content length. If content is a InputStream, this parameter should be specified, as not doing so will introduce a performance loss as the contents will have to be persisted on disk before being uploaded. Otherwise, it is ignored. An exception to this rule are InputStreams returned by Mule Http Connector: if stream has Content-Length information, it will be used. In any case a content length of 0 is interpreted as an unspecified content length.
integer.caption: Content Length
integer.name: contentLength

string.description: The content md5, encoded in base 64. If content is a file, it is ignored.
string.caption: Content Md5

string.name: bucketName

string.description: Causes keys that contain the same string between the prefix and the first occurrence of the delimiter to be rolled up into a single result element in the list. These rolled-up keys are not returned elsewhere in the response. The most commonly used delimiter is "/", which simulates a hierarchical organization similar to a file system directory structure.
string.caption: Delimiter
string.name: delimiter

string.description: Where in the sorted list of all versions in the specified bucket to begin returning results. Results are always ordered first lexicographically (i.e. alphabetically) and then from most recent version to least recent version. If a keyMarker is used without a versionIdMarker, results begin immediately after that key's last version. When a keyMarker is used with a versionIdMarker, results begin immediately after the version with the specified key and version ID.
string.caption: Key Marker
string.name: keyMarker

string.description: Optional parameter restricting the response to keys which begin with the specified prefix. You can use prefixes to separate a bucket into different sets of keys in a way similar to how a file system uses folders.
string.caption: Prefix
string.name: prefix

string.description: Where in the sorted list of all versions in the specified bucket to begin returning results. Results are always ordered first lexicographically (i.e. alphabetically) and then from most recent version to least recent version. A keyMarker must be specified when specifying a versionIdMarker. Results begin immediately after the version with the specified key and version ID.
string.caption: Version Id Marker
string.name: versionIdMarker

integer.description: The maximum number of results to include in the response.
integer.caption: Max Results
integer.name: maxResults

enum.description: The encoding method to be applied on the response. An object key can contain any Unicode character; however, XML 1.0 parser cannot parse some characters, such as characters with an ASCII value from 0 to 10. For characters that are not supported in XML 1.0, you can add this parameter to request that Amazon S3 encode the keys in the response.
enum.caption: Encoding Type
enum.name: encodingType

string.description: The access key provided by Amazon, needed for non annoynous operations.
string.caption: Access Key
string.name: accessKey

string.description: The secrete key provided by Amazon, needed for non annoynous operations.
string.caption: Secret Key
string.name: secretKey

string.description: The target bucket's name.
string.caption: Bucket Name
string.name: bucketName

string.description: Causes keys that contain the same string between a prefix and the first occurrence of the delimiter to be rolled up into a single result element. These rolled-up keys are not returned elsewhere in the response. The most commonly used delimiter is "/", which simulates a hierarchical organization similar to a file system directory structure.
string.caption: Delimiter
string.name: delimiter

string.description: Where in the bucket to begin listing. The list will only include keys that occur lexicographically after the marker.
string.caption: Marker
string.name: marker

string.description: The prefix of the objects to be listed. If unspecified, all objects are listed.
string.caption: Prefix
string.name: prefix

integer.description: The maximum number of keys to include in the response. If maxKeys is not specified, Amazon S3 will limit the number of results in the response.
integer.caption: Max Keys
integer.name: maxKeys

enum.description: The encoding method to be applied on the response. An object key can contain any Unicode character; however, XML 1.0 parser cannot parse some characters, such as characters with an ASCII value from 0 to 10. For characters that are not supported in XML 1.0, you can add this parameter to request that Amazon S3 encode the keys in the response.
enum.caption: Encoding Type
enum.name: encodingType
